subject: wayland-egl: do not require 'gl' to build (libs)
commitMessage:
wayland-egl: do not require 'gl' to build (libs)

'gl' would pull X11, and is unnecessary anyways (fixes 'gl'
LIBS check which happens in some cases, like when doing
"--enable-gl-flavor-gles").

Change-Id: I1abd5adf188feab3dedd24e14d1da8b20da4e09b
Signed-off-by: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.
Patch Set 1: Verified+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2
Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Patch Set 1:

The tag submit/tizen_generic/20140410.130417 was pushed, but it was not completed because of the following reason(s):

- The tag means you want to submit commit d9095ca8f044f54e1c64ee7e2d89c52c23257933 in tizen_generic branch to OBS, but this commit does NOT exist in tizen_generic branch. Please use correct branch name as version in tag name submit/{version}/{date.time}.

Suggest to use "gbs submit" to trigger submission, or use following command to create tag "git tag submit/${version}/$(date --utc +%%Y%%m%%d.%%H%%M%%S) -m "****" ".

subject: Wayland_EGL: Add return value to eng_setup
commitMessage:
Wayland_EGL: Add return value to eng_setup

Removing this block can lead to undefined behavior. It was removed by the
following commit:

commit 5cf962b39e77662dd6148a6a3468acbb51c78878
Author: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@eurogiciel.fr>
Date:   Thu Dec 5 17:50:58 2013 +0100

    Fix window hide/show() using withdrawn_set()

    Bug-Tizen: https://bugs.tizen.org/jira/browse/TIVI-2048
    Bug-Upstream: https://phab.enlightenment.org/T155

    Co-Authored-by: Rafael Antognolli <rafael.antognolli@intel.com>

    Signed-off-by: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>

Change-Id: I25844c7e31db55f1100d663633aa9374bda306b0
Signed-off-by: Eduardo Lima (Etrunko) <eduardo.lima@intel.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)
Uploaded patch set 2.
Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

This "return 1" existed before, but was removed because it made ico (old version) crash. Now that ico is gone from the official images (or we have a new version ?) it may not be relevant anymore. Careful, though.

Patch Set 2: Verified+1 Code-Review+1

We already made this patch. However we could not reproduce the above clash in the patched environment. So the best way is that this patch approves and then tested by QA team, I believe. Agree?

Patch Set 2: Verified+1 Code-Review+2

Thanks for the confirmation.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: evas/wayland_egl: Do not create a new surface if we already have one.
commitMessage:
evas/wayland_egl: Do not create a new surface if we already have one.

"Second eglCreateWindowSurface call should fail according to EGL
standard, the fact that it doesn't (and further eglMakeCurrent call
works) is just EGL implementation author's good will."

Patch by: Wang Quanxian <quanxian.wang@intel.com>

Change-Id: I5f426fbe0ab355bd650453ae73329c7db3645479

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+2

Reviewed upstream already, and tested.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Patch Set 1:

A SR (Submit Request) has been triggered to submit the commit to OBS Tizen project.
- Submitter: Rafael Antognolli <rafael.antognolli@intel.com>
- Comments: Fix for TIVI-1571.
- Git project: platform/upstream/evas

subject: change {without x} to {with x}
commitMessage:
change {without x} to {with x}

The display server based on X or Wayland, is now a choice of different profile in Tizen 3.0.
Basically and consistently, two macros were used "with wayland" and "with x".
Below summarize the combination of the macros:

| wayland |  x  | meaning
|---------------------------
|   0     |  1  | pure X11 platform(no wayland)
|   1     |  0  | pure wayland platform (no X11)
|   1     |  1  | wayland but X compatibility
|   0     |  0  | no X and no wayland

This method unifies the meaning and usage. Deploy this method to evas package.

Change-Id: Ia5a37460e89433bfb21201671948ff2cf03db25e

subject: evas/wayland_egl: Use packed_depth_stencil when possible
commitMessage:
evas/wayland_egl: Use packed_depth_stencil when possible

According to OpenGL standard, 9.4.3 Required Framebuffer Formats:
"However, when both depth and stencil attachments are
present, implementations are only required to support
framebuffer objects where both attachments refer to
the same image."

So use packed_depth_stencil when it's possible

Change-Id: I92c4e0bb70e87bbfa69e65b5ece719c90d07f316
Signed-off-by: Stanislav Vorobiov <s.vorobiov@samsung.com>

subject: evas/image: Add video surface caps.
commitMessage:
evas/image: Add video surface caps.

Wayland subsurfaces can be used as video surfaces too, similarly to
Ecore_X windows. However, they support a different set of features. Some
of them, like subsurface clipping and scaling, might be added in the
future, but so far we must work with what we have.

This commit allows to set an enum bitfield to the Video_Surface, with
the default value being one that will keep the same behavior as before,
for Ecore_X window. Thus, backward compatibility should not be broken.

It's possible to inform Evas that the surface in question is not able to
resize or scale, or that it's above or below the original canvas
surface. This allows Evas to show the surface itself, or use a buffer of
pixels instead, when the capabilities are not available.

Change-Id: I35764b72c31792e8af8c8d83a3f4694a1ae5fa87

subject: evas/wayland_egl: Skip makecurrent if re->win is NULL.
commitMessage:
evas/wayland_egl: Skip makecurrent if re->win is NULL.

This happens on wayland_egl because we free and set the re->win to NULL
on ecore_evas_hide(). It's a workaround since the proper fix would be to
not free the re->win on hide, but that will require a lot more changes.

subject: evas/wayland_egl: Force EGL_PLATFORM to wayland.
commitMessage:
evas/wayland_egl: Force EGL_PLATFORM to wayland.

Since we are already inside wayland_egl code, force this env var to
avoid the EGLNativeDisplayType autodetection (done by EGL code), which
seems to be incorrect.

Note: revert this as soon as EGL autodetection gets fixed.

Patch Set 1: Verified; Looks good to me, approved
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Add build flags to get WRT widgets rendering in hardware acceleration mode
commitMessage:
Add build flags to get WRT widgets rendering in hardware acceleration mode

  - wihtout this patch the only way to get widgets display is to manually export HW_ACC=NOT_USE

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

rpmlint checked packaging/evas.spec: 0 errors, 1 warnings.
- line 8: W: non-standard-group Graphics/EFL

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       armv7hl        unresolvable   

 standard       x86_64         succeeded      

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1: Verified; Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

This patch is needed to get WRT widgets display.
Without this patch we only get a black screen in hardware acceleration mode (export HW_ACC=USE).

reviewer.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

comments.message: Patch Set 1: Verified; Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

Is this used by IVI? If so, nothing related to X11 should be built right? Probably Rafael has some opinions on this matter.

Patch Set 1:

those new options as they are in the spec will be also available in IVI. so, the question is this will in any way affect building for wayland...

Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Yes, they will affect the build on IVI image, in which it will try to enforce dependency on X libs, possibly breaking the build.

Those X specific flags should be inside an %else clause, for building without Wayland (and on X, I suppose).

Additionally, just xlib or xcb should be used, not necessarily both. You should check which one is being used and disable the other, or let it to autodetection.

I also think that the pixman related changes, and the tile-rotate one, should be on a separate patch, explaining why are they needed, unless they are also really needed for rendering widgets on hardware acceleration mode (which I'm not sure they are). Anyway, a better explanation would help IMHO.
Patch Set 1: Abandoned
Patch Set 1: Restored
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 2:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       armv7hl        unresolvable   

 standard       x86_64         succeeded      

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 2:

Looks way better to me, and now it won't affect Wayland build.

I would still like to know the reason why --enable-fb and --disable-static are being added (and the last option wasn't added in the prior version of the patch, if I'm not wrong).

Patch Set 2: Verified; Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Sorry for the delay, 
Happy to see this looks better to you.
I have removed pixman related flags, but these may be added later depending on performance tests results.
Note that I have also removed the xcb build flags although it wouldn't be a real problem to set this with the xlib one: by default xlib rendering engine is used.
Concerning the --enable-fb flags, this will permits us to get access to the framebuffer for current work on debug/fix for Webkit : we are currently working on gstreamer1.0 hw accelerated process.
This flag is supposed to disappear very soon..

Patch Set 2: Verified; Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

OK, that's all fine then.

I was more concerned because pixman and fb flags were added on the commit, but the commit message sad nothing about them, and they are not needed to enable WRT widgets in hardware accelerated mode.

Anyway, looks good to me.
Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, approved
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: evas/gl: Restore framebuffer after texture creation.
commitMessage:
evas/gl: Restore framebuffer after texture creation.

If we don't do this, the framebuffer object used on
shader_array_flush() will be wrong.

NOTE: shader_array_flush() should take care of setting the
fbo correctly.
